definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
(old) cap (garment)/military officer of low rank (in former times)/preceding

pinyin: shou3 zi4 mu3 pin1 yin1 ci2

sentences.english: Well spelling bee is a well-known competition of spelling words.
sentences.chinese: 今天的話題是拚字比賽。

sentences.english: It is inappropriate to advocate a "contest of attrition " for the Chinese Red Army today.
sentences.chinese: “拚消耗”的主張，對於中國紅軍來說是不適時宜的。

sentences.english: In Matou Town Xilian and his troops fought them tooth and nail at the cost of hundreds of casualties.
sentences.chinese: 錫聯在馬頭鎮拚了一次，一拚就是幾百人傷亡。

sentences.english: In Matou Town Xilian and his troops fought them tooth and nail at the cost of hundreds of casualties.
sentences.chinese: 錫聯在馬頭鎮拚了一次，一拚就是幾百人傷亡。

sentences.english: This year's NFS puts the focus on head-to-head showdowns as street racing is showcased.
sentences.chinese: 這次NFS將專注於表達只有街車互相比拚的賽事。

sentences.english: In 1912, they began to experiment with collage and papier collé.
sentences.chinese: 1912年，他們開始做抽象拚貼畫和紙貼畫。

sentences.english: The picture was faked by sticking together two photos.
sentences.chinese: 這張照片是用兩張照片拚在一起僞造的。

sentences.english: So you took your family to the mall, and everyone was excited about a fun-filled day of shopping.
sentences.chinese: 你帶上一家子逛商場，每個人都開心的血拚了一天。

sentences.english: Laojiaohua, today you told me is winning the contest, or the normalization of life phase?
sentences.chinese: 老叫化，你今日跟我是比武決勝呢，還是性命相拚？

definition: to fight with all one has
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
Facebook (Internet slang, pun reading "you must die")
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
from now on/in the future/time to come
to give thought (to others)/to consider (other people's needs)/also pr. [zhao2 xiang3]
